summary: Alpacas are South American mammals related to llamas. They're often farmed for their soft, valuable wool, which comes in two types: straight "locks" (Suri) and wavy "crimped" (Huacaya). Alpacas are smaller than llamas and communicate through body language, sometimes spitting to show dominance. They were domesticated from wild vicu√±as and guanacos thousands of years ago. Today, they're found worldwide, with popular breeds in North America, Europe, and Australia.
title: Alpaca
